member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS
member.summary: Specifies a lowest and highest base address and alignment as part of an extended parameter to a function that manages virtual memory.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.LowestStartingAddress
member.summary: Specifies the lowest acceptable address. This address must be a multiple of the allocation granularity returned by , or a multiple of the large page size returned by if large pages are being requested. If this member is NULL, then there is no lower limit.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.HighestEndingAddress
member.summary: Specifies the highest acceptable address (inclusive). This address must not exceed lpMaximumApplicationAddress returned by . If this member is NULL, then there is no upper limit.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.Alignment
member.summary: Specifies power-of-2 alignment. Specifying 0 aligns the returned address on the system allocation granularity.
